Reviews.Title: “full kitchen made trip easier”
Reviews.Author: Don A
Reviews.Content: Background info: booked with points; platinum status; didn't use shuttle; parking lot pretty crowded; didn't use pool (wasn't that inviting looking); didn't eat at restaurant or use room service. Even though we arrived late at night and the hotel was overbooked, our room was available. We were upgraded to an extended stay suite which has a full kitchen. Staff doing double-duty at night so we waited a bit before being checked in. Interesting bit of history that the hotel was the first Embassy Suites in the country before being converted to a Holiday Inn & Suites. Access from parking lots are through locked gates into a nicely landscaped courtyard. Hallways to suites are exterior facing courtyard. It was great to have a full kitchen as we like to prepare our own breakfast, lunch and snacks for the road. Grocery store was within driving distance of the hotel. Microwave was the strongest I've ever experienced and stove top is a nice electric glass surface. Dishwasher included but we just used it as a drying rack. Bathroom layout slightly odd as the sink sits in the hallway connecting the bedroom with the living room. Nice to have a closed door between living room and bedroom so one can continue to work while other person sleeps. Bedroom window faces a roof (not sure how this is laid out) on which all the HVAC equipment sits and makes noise. Not too much noise, but ugly enough that you won't be looking out the window anytime soon. However, climate control worked perfectly -- air not too dry and not too humid; quite operation. And, even though hotel fully booked, couldn't hear neighbors (on the side or above).

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale Holiday Inn 3 miles from airport”
Reviews.Author: appaloosas3
Reviews.Content: Nicest Holiday Inn ever stayed at ( the one in Simi Valley, Ca. is a close second). Beautiful pool, landscaping, large, roomy suite w/ balcony, pretty and contemporary furnishings, most comfy beds and bedding, nice restaurant w/ large yummy breakfast buffet. Great room rate as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and a VERY nice airport hotel - rather like a resort near the airport”
Reviews.Author: dandjaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the day we arrived into Phoenix in January 2012. We booked our room using Priority Club points. We booked a king-size suite and requested a crib for our 15 month old son. After a very long flight it was really nice to be picked up by the kind shuttle bus driver & taken the hotel. Probably one of the friendliest people we'd ever encountered, he helped us bring our bags in (with our long flight/jet lag & late hour it was definitely appreciated!). We checked into our room & requested some milk for our son - there in a flash. We also inquired if the restaurant was serving food & indeed it was :) We went to our room to put our son to bed and the crib (requested in our booking) wasn't in our room, but we called reception & it was brought really quickly by the very kind maintenance crew man. He even brought us extra sheets because he very honestly said, 'I wasn't sure what you needed.' We got ourselves situated - our room was great as we were able to put our son to sleep in the bedroom (in his crib) & shut the door, then sit out in the sitting room/lounge area. My husband went to get food from the restaurant for our dinner as it was about 9:30 PM now. He got us a salad and one of the yummiest Turkey Focaccia sandwiches we'd ever had!!! So, if you are at the hotel, I'd recommend that sandwich for sure. The salad was so-so, edible, but nothing to get excited about, but the sandwich, wow! Then, we retired for the evening. Had a great sleep & woke up in the AM, then walked up the road a bit to have breakfast at an IHOP (International House of Pancakes). A nice stroll up there & back, then we left the hotel to head back to the airport to pick up our rental car for our stay. The staff at the hotel, Zachary in particular, were really helpful and nice in letting us check out a bit late as our son was napping. We would happily stay there again if needing an airport hotel in Phoenix. Also, (although we didn't take advantage of it as we were off to visit with family after our first night there) I would expect it's a very convenient spot to explore downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in general”
Reviews.Author: Viviann F
Reviews.Content: Hotel accommodations were very nice. Comfortable, clean and smart looking. Staff was excellent in answering questions and providing directions. For my trip this location was ideal to everywhere. Parking never a problem. Justin was the best! Room service left a bit to be desired. I ordered the pork chops. They were dry and the glaze lacked any flavor. The veggies and potato were goo,d but I didn't get any butter with it (oh poor me). Also, only one setting was delivered with the food. Delivery of room service was a bit slow so my food was warm almost cold when it was delivered. The breakfast made up for everything. Other than that, for a quick trip I would recommend it. viviann.ferea@sjsu.edu

Reviews.Title: “Staff is friendly. Hotel is new.”
Reviews.Author: ADavis91381
Reviews.Content: It was a decent hotel for a business trip when my favorite was full booked for my extended stay. The Holiday Inn is a brand new hotel and it shows in the modern take on furnishings. The staff was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “extemely good value, clean, well run and great staff”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBend815
Reviews.Content: I purchased via Kayak/Hotwire and got fantastic price. I was apprehensive because the price seemed to be low for a quality hotel. I was very impressed with all aspects of this hotel. If you are paying your own expenses this is a fabulous buy.Ttwo rooms with nice outside fire pit to relax after a long day. The Fox news non stop at lobby bar is a bit much, but bartender was willing to change. I travel 100+ days a year and this is one of the best deals I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: jeff w
Reviews.Content: Weak internet wi-fi that didn't work, poor breakfast food, maids forget to leave shampoo, poor air conditioning that is either freezing or hot, Fox news playing on all the TV's in lobby and restaurant, this after Fox defended George Zimmerman.

Reviews.Title: “This one is a repeat”
Reviews.Author: pfafftonian
Reviews.Content: This is the best inexpensive hotel I have found in the Tempe / airport area. It’s certainly not fancy, but for the price it’s very nice. All the rooms are two-room suites that open onto an outdoor courtyard with a pool and sitting area. There are suites nicer and pricier than the one I had. The living room has a sleep sofa, overstuffed chair, dresser, large full-length mirror, large screen TV, and a bar with microwave, sink, and fridge. No dishes, by the way – it seems there should be at least some dishes. The bedroom area is as large as most hotel rooms in the area, with a dresser, large TV, sink, and free-standing wardrobe. There are four pillows per bed, two of which are clearly labeled “Firm” and two “Soft”. (As a lover of firm pillows, I really appreciate this.) As others have noted, the bathroom is teeny. If I were trying to sleep a family in this suite, or perhaps my spouse and another couple, the small bathroom would probably be an issue. But with just one person, no big deal. On the downside: When I arrived, the room was (ahem!) not fully supplied. No problem – until two days went by without being replenished. Housekeeping came promptly when I called. I gave this hotel 4 stars. If the management and staff would “pick it up” just slightly, I’d gladly go to 5 stars. And I will be back. It’s nice. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Positives Outweighed the Few Negatives”
Reviews.Author: crucesflyfisher
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my siblings on a weekend get-together for spring training. It is an older place, but has been very nicely refurbished. I was very impressed with the quality and style of our adjoining suites, especially the bathrooms - 5 stars for them! The pool area was also very nice, with fresh landscaping and pleasing courtyard design. We did not experience any rowdiness at all, the only people we saw all weekend were very nice families with kids. The building surrounds this whole area, so the fact that the property is not in the best part of town is no problem at all. And it was an excellent value. The meal service was a bit slow, but that was not a major issue since we did most of our eating out at restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looked nice but the wrong crowd for a family place”
Reviews.Author: deslaw
Reviews.Content: Nicely redone and clean hotel but that is the extent of the positive comments Young family for an early flight Sunday morning and found out the quiet time started at midnight. Rowdy drunk 20-30 year old crowd having a good time but at others expense, not a good idea for an airpot hotel . Had a large room at the back of the hotel ground floor by the main a/c unit and could not sleep all night as I could hear it start up through the single pane windows about every 20 minutes Seemed like there was a gang element at the hotel (ie clean shaven , muscle bound tatoo'd young men driving tinted out sports car in and out of the hotel all night) Police showed up at about midnight on force to deal with some problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunshinecoasthiker
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicest I've stayed in and such a reasonable price. The rooms were so spacious and lovely with a separate living room and TV. Very comfortable and clean. The design with the hotel built so there was a courtyard in the middle which was lush with plants and areas to sit, pool and hot tub, was like being somewhere else. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near the Phoenix airport”
Reviews.Author: Silverwoods
Reviews.Content: I probably would have given this a very good rating except our room was close to the main street and it was very noisy. It made it difficult to sleep. Ask for a room away from the main road and you will be fine. The breakfast and free internet were both good as well.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: DJHeileman
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three with a teenage girl in tow. We travel a lot and always look for a "Suite" type situation. We were very pleasantly surprised by this property. It has a "resort" feel to it. Our room was clean, spacious, and well appointed. We had a two-burner stove, dishwasher, and full size refrigerator. The staff were friendly and helpful. The interior of the lobby looked like it should be in South Beach Florida! Very art-deco and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: This hotel's service is terrible. I feel so sorry for the front desk staff taking the anger of the guests. When I checked into the hotel the rooms were clean but the beds were not made. Instead the linens were on the "dirty" floor. Yes, it was vacuumed but walking in white socks they blackened. Obviously the carpet has never been shampooed. Then, during our stay we had to request for housekeeping each day. Every day we did NOT get housekeeping. We had to take our trash to the front desk and get towels from the front desk. We had no soap in the bathroom at checkin and no coffee or coffee cups. The manager NEVER responded to our messages. During our stay I requested an iron, The one in the room was broke. I needed to iron shirts. I was told there was no housekeeping that evening to get me an iron and the maintenance guy repeatedly said over the radio that for the next two hours he was too busy to get me one. I understand the front desk can leave but why no housekeeping and when is maintenance exempt at a hotel from providing guest service. The ownership and management company of theis hotel: Jordan Hotels, LLP and Ocean Properties are money oriented and have no idea how to run a hotel. Avoid ALL of thier hotels!!! Oh, and this so-called "airport" hotel does not have a reliable shuttle. Who knows when it runs. certainly not when you need to be picked up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Europetoday
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the spacious bedroom and separate living area. Bathroom was a small but adequate. The microwave and small fridge were convenient for preparing snacks or quick meals. We found the bed comfortable and room was very clean. The pool, whirlpool and patio were very nice and inviting. The location was near the airport and area attractions were easily accessible . Front desk was friendly and helpful. Overall we found this a good value, particularly for families on a budget. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “customer service”
Reviews.Author: aikaekefe
Reviews.Content: this hotel pretty much ruined my family vacation. front desk help and managers are very rude, disrespectful, and cannot explain anything to you. it was a total mess with reservations during check in. our rooms were prepaid and the stupid manager charges our credit cards again for the stay. charged my credit card again for a cancelled reservation. 2 of the rooms were not clean, had to wait for housekeeping. i would not recommend this place. you would need to call their 800 number to get something resolved or explained. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE SO U CAN ENJOY YOUR VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Don't want want to interrupt your conversation.”
Reviews.Author: DamianL23
Reviews.Content: The room was huge and the beds were comfy, but the bathroom was tiny and I do mean tiny just a really small shower and toilet. Did I mention the mold? While we were there one of the elevators broke stranding a woman in it. It was still not fixed two days later when we left. I would over look all of these things except the poor customer service. Upon check in I asked Zach if we received any breakfast or drink coupons for being Platinum Priority club members. He said he couldn't offer us anything because we had gotten a really low rate and then he said they were still trying to work those perks out with Corporate because they were a new property. Not sure which excuse to believe but we got nothing. Then upon check out, Stephen at the front desk did not even excuse himself from his personal conversation with the Starbucks employee to check us out and didnt tell us when we were done. He left us standing there like fools until we asked if that was all he needed. We are frequent travelers and that was a first. If you want excellent customer service, stay at the Holiday inn airport south on 48th street. They really know how to treat their guests, not like the north location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: Michel1030
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Thursday Feb. 23, 2012 and was very happy with everything. The room was very spacious and comfortable-- a large flat screen tv in the outer room with sofa, desk, sink, coffeee pot, fridge, and another tv in the bedroom. Outside lounging area with pools, hot tub, fire pits, lush landscaping, peaceful and quiet. Only 10 minutes from airport, CVS and supermarket across the street, fast food restaurant. Staff very friendly, nice bar in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise in the night”
Reviews.Author: SCSweendaddy
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in PHX when a flight cancelled and grabbed this holel because it was close to the airport and the prince was pretty good (under $100). Not expecting much but was blown away when we got there. The van was on the spot to pick us up and the hotel was really pretty. The room was great - spacious, quiet, well laid out and the bed and pillows were the most comfortable we have had in a while. Grounds were beautiful and the staff was very nice. We didn't have much time to stay as we were back to the airport early but would have liked to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: OliveK
Reviews.Content: My son was visiting GCU. The hotel location was perfect, just 15 minutes to the college and 10 minutes to the car rental return area at Sky Harbor Airport. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms beautiful as well. Very quiet even though they told me that they were at full capacity. The rooms are very spacious. The staff was super nice. I would have given the hotel a 5 star rating for cleanliness had it not been for all of the left over glasses and dirty plates left out side from the night before in the beautiful firepit lounge area. Sad to see on my departure morning. Still, I would stay here over and over... this property is just beautiful. Keep in mind the breakfast is not free, it is a "just ok" buffet for $10.00 per person, (I think they do have a childs menu that is free?) or you may order off of a breakfast menu. The main waitress in the breakfast area was extremely attentive, and so pleasant... I wish I would have gotten her name :)! I would highly recommend this hotel, truly lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: photomikey
Reviews.Content: Booked a run-of-house room at this hotel, received a two-room suite. I am led to believe that this is an all-suite hotel. Beautiful pool and amenities, and for the rate I paid it is one of my best bargains of the year. Would return in a heartbeat, am disappointed I didn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum member with Holiday Inn and stay over 140 nights a year on the road. This hotel for the weary business traveler is fantastic. Clean, Inviting and the rooms are comfortable. This is a newer hotel and the staff is friendly. The hotel is close to ASU with a lot of restaurants and fun places to go. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvdabigeasy
Reviews.Content: Recently remodeled, suite style hotel. Restaurant, room service, pool/hot tub, great outdoor setting with lounge furniture and gas fire pits. Had a cocktail, smoked a stogie and enjoyed the company of other guests. Micro, fridge, coffee, 2 great TV's, LED reading lights bedside. All new bath fixtures including Toto tall toilet with MMH (Make Mama Happy) seat. Just touch it, the seat goes down! Vanity is outside of bath & toilet in bedroom. Now this is where the only issues arose. First, there should be a bath mat for this area. The hot and cold faucets were reversed, there was only one bar of soap for sink and bath and the body lotion had been previously used. No problem. I left a $5 tip, asked for these things and extra coffee, mats, soap and my room was immaculate for night number 2. GM checked me out upon leaving, had nice conversation, mentioned faucet status, said he would have it fixed. This is definitely a hotel you shouldn't hesitate to book. Road Warrior approved.

Reviews.Title: “Great value that exceeds expectations.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckLLB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites Airport North in Phoenix for 5 days while travelling on business. Overall I had a very pleasant experience and found the hotel exceeded expectations in many respects – in particular for a Holiday Inn property that charged a very reasonable daily rate. The hotel has clearly been recently renovated and both (i) the main lobby/restaurant/bar area and (ii) the guest rooms have a modern sleekness to them that, again, was much nicer than expected. A minor detail to be sure, but the beaded curtain in the lobby that separates the bar area from the main lobby is nothing short of impressive. There is also a small Starbucks installation in the lobby which, from my perspective, could not have been better. A nod to the staff at the Starbucks who were particularly friendly throughout my stay. To the rear of the main lobby there is a small, functional business center. Only one computer could print, however, and the windows-based system offered only the barest of functionality. As an example, I needed to scan a document to PDF and this could not be done – not through the business center, nor through the hotel front desk. This was terribly inconvenient and just a little too 2005 frankly. Service upon check-in and at check-out, as well as overall, was very good and hotel staff were always polite and professional. One evening, when I asked the hotel’s reception to call me a taxi, they kindly offered up a free trip in their hotel shuttle which was appreciated. Although I’m not positive, based on the layout of the hotel, I suspect that each of the rooms is in a fact a two-room suite. The suites themselves are modern, relatively well appointed and very clean. The main living room area included a sofa, decent sized flat-screen TV, a small kitchenette (with a bar fridge, sink, microwave and coffee maker) and a work space with a simple, but very functional, two-tier desk. The bedroom featured a king size bed, another flat-screen and in-room sink. The individual built-in reading lamps were a nice touch as well. The bathroom itself was very small but – and this is hugely important to me – it was IMMACULATE. Crisp white from corner to corner and top to bottom. This was, without a doubt, one of cleanest hotel bathrooms I have ever seen. That alone made this stay enjoyable. The view, however, from my 4th floor suite was bleak – overlooking a parking lot and the rear of the hotel. Other than a quick sandwich at lunch on my first day, I did not dine in the hotel’s main restaurant although the separate breakfast restaurant offered a nice selection (including a breakfast buffet), a number of healthy options, efficient service and cheap prices. Every morning I was greeted politely by the waitstaff and was them promptly asked “Will you be using any coupons today?” Having never stayed at a Holiday Inn before I felt a little out of the loop – where do people get all these breakfast coupons and why didn’t I have any? This remains an unsolved mystery! I used the fitness center on three or four occasions. It was fine. It is equipped with two elliptical machines and four treadmills – one of which did not work all week. There was also a work-out bench, some free weights, a yoga mat and an exercise ball. I usually had the place to myself other than on one morning. Not a big deal at all, but the TV in the gym should really have better reception and channel availability. I did not use the main pool/hot tub area although having walked by it several times per day, it looked very clean and well maintained. The outdoor lounging areas within the hotel’s courtyard are also a very nice touch. Overall, this was a pleasant surprise in terms of both quality of stay and value proposition. Considering that this is an airport Holiday Inn, the size and quality of the suites, I really don’t think you could expect anything more. In fact, if they can get a scanner into their business center, I am quite likely to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort and full of room”
Reviews.Author: aaronbond007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very convenient to the airport, has a massive amount of room in each suite, and is very comfortable. The inner plaza was very nice and there were fire pits to sit around. What shocked me the most about the hotel was its affordable price. In my opinion it offered a better deal than any other hotel of its kind in Phoenix considering what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BWRaleigh
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are done over very nicely and the hotel is in good condition. I was very impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the food in the restaurant was very good. The young woman bartending was very friendly and the lobby was very comfortable and inviting. I was not able to use the Starbucks but I thought it was a nice touch. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than your average Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: jhjr
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Holiday Inns I've ever seen. Suites are large with two HD flat screen TVs and balconies. Kitchen included utenisils, pots, pans, plates etc. Bathroom was a little small but fine. The best feature of the hotel has to be the public spaces. The pool area is beautiful with conversation areas and fire pits. The lobby and restaurant were also very attractive and there was a sundry shop in the lobby. Room service was fine. The hotel was no more than a 10 minute drive to the airport and the shuttle was prompt. Overall, an excellent hotel and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: cu-later67
Reviews.Content: An older completely remodeled hotel. Service Service Service. Rooms are large with separate bedroom from living area. Microwave, small refrigerator and comfortable furniture. Stay here if the location is convenient for your stay in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, poor shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: LonghornDallas
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely updated hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Shuttle service from the airport stops at 9:30 p.m., so be prepared to shell out $22 for a cab ride for any flight arriving late. Desk clerks are all very friendly, but usually under staffed at night.

Reviews.Title: “nearly a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bigsandy35
Reviews.Content: having a suite, with great atmosphere, wonderful pool area etc should make this a TOP hotel but they have just a couple of things they need to improve on. every time the air con came on during the night it sounded like a 727 warming up and woke us up. we finally had to turn it off. this was ok in january but would NOT be ok in warmer months. also, the pillows were much too hard, both of us ended up with sore necks. we asked room service for softer pillows but they were the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: holzem4
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel through Priceline for a quick stay before getting on our plane home the next day. Wish we could have stayed there longer. What a great place! The center court area makes you feel like you are at a resort in Mexico. The staff were super helpful and kind. They learned we had just come from funeral and were asking about how we were doing with our loss. In the morning I was having trouble printing our boarding passes and they brought me to the office area and let me use whatever I needed to get the job done. We WILL stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find! We will return.”
Reviews.Author: LoisSedona
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on Hotwire due to the 100% consumer satisfaction. I can see why! The property is really well manicured, with a "spa", "resort" feel. There are fire pits outside, and cozy areas to sit. I only wish we had arrived earlier (and we weren't leaving so early in the AM) so we could have enjoyed the property. The rooms are clean and VERY spacious. The format of the room reminded me of the Embassy Suites, whereas you have a sitting area in the front; the bedroom in the back. The lighting in the bedroom was the best I have ever experienced at a 3-4 Star hotel. We were actually able to provide "intimate" mood lighting via the small light fixtures alongside the bed. The bathroom/shower area is small. But what we liked is there were two sinks in the room, both outside of the tub/toilet area. So there was plenty of room/space for two people to get ready. I would recommend asking for a room away from the street side of the building. The only complaint I had was when I called for the shuttle to pick me up upon my return to Phoenix (I left my car at the hotel for two days). I had to call back twice, as I was placed on hold for nearly 5 minutes. When the person at the front desk asked to place me on hold again, I said, "No, I have already been on hold and I just want to know where to get the shuttle back to the hotel." The person who answered the phone said, "Well, if you'd just be patient, I'll tell you." I found this to be inappropriate. I was going to let it go but this same person told the shuttle driver to pick me up at Terminal 3, NOT Terminal 4 where I was standing. So I ended up waiting for 30-35 minutes for the shuttle. I let the manager know, and he could NOT have been kinder and immediately called this person into his office as he did not condone the behaviour of his employee. Customer service is definitely a top priority for this hotel. The bar area is nice. We were surprised they did not have limes when we ordered a vodka tonic. We did not have a chance to try the restaurant. The only "down" side is the layout of the hotel is a bit confusing; especially when you are arriving late and a bit weary. Finding our room took longer than expected! But it allowed us to peruse the grounds; all well worth it! Again, we will definitely be back and we look forward to having a more leisurely visit the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern, a true suite!”
Reviews.Author: imandy0517
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms--a separate enclosed living room with TV and bedroom with own TV, bathrooms a tad small, but on my 2.5 week road trip, this was certainly one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: WSG34
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that has had a very nice renovation. The grounds are beautiful (although the sprinklers were watering the morning after a significant rain storm). The lobby as shown in the hotel pictures is beautiful. The rooms are very spacious - 2 room suites and very nicely appointed. Nice tile bathroom / showers. This is probably one of the nicer Holiday Inn's I've stayed at. When I checked in, the front desk clerk was a bit overwhelmed, but very polite and apologetic about it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the land of strip malls”
Reviews.Author: Diane P
Reviews.Content: Phoenix has a lot of strip malls, but near the Airport is an oasis, the newly remodeled Holiday Inn & Suites. From the street you would never guess what lies within. The grounds are lush and give one the sense of being inside a high-end resort. In addition to the pool area there is a huge gazebo adjacent to an outdoor lounge area with firepits to add to the evening ambiance. WiFi throughout so several people brought their laptops to work in the gazebo. The rooms are the large, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the restaurant is amazing with an excellent menu. We enjoyed several dinners there and the quality was top-notch each time. The separate breakfast room is similar. One breakfast at this property and you'll never want to see another Holiday Inn Express breakfast. We will definitely return during our annual visits to the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Every Holiday Inn should be like this...”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: Good Location near the airport, but out of the skanky neighborhood that surrounds most airports. Front desk was quick and friendly with the check in. The rooms are huge with a separate sitting room/desk area. Perfect for doing some work in the room. Beds were fantastically comfortable and the whole place just felt clean. The landscaping in the central courtyard was nearly resort-like with gas rock fireplaces, upholstered furniture, lots of plants and greenery. Very friendly bartender in the lobby. Shuttle driver was so friendly and helpful that he should be training all hotel shuttle drivers. About a mile walk north to the nearest full service restaurant (Applebees) I think this used to be another hotel brand, but they really did a nice job on the remodel making it somewhere special. I could see using this place for conferences or meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay near the Phoenix Airport”
Reviews.Author: copernicus2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short ride from the airport. Shuttle service was prompt and friendly. The room was very comfortable. The staff was courteous. We had an excellent meal in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Korat1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week of November for 6 days. This hotel was a great value for the money (I booked on Hotwire). The proximity to the airport and airport shuttle was great, as well as the shuttle driver, who was very helpful. The fact that there was a fridge and microwave in the room was great, since I have special dietary restrictions. The pool and spa area was clean and I enjoyed using them both. The free wifi was excellent and fast. The only negative is that I had a room facing 44th Street, and the traffic noise was loud (to me) during the evening and sometimes through the night. Then again, I am used to a very quiet home in the suburbs, so it may not bother you if you are used to city living. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Windows that Open”
Reviews.Author: JAB905
Reviews.Content: The price and location near the airport were the intial draw. The property has recently undergone a major overhaul and they have done a lovely job. The rooms are not hermeticaly sealed boxes, you can actually open a large patio door to the outside. Windows on the couryard side also open for added ventilation. The suite was spacious although the bathroom/shower area was very small. Front desk and airport shuttle personnel were helpful and friendly. So far this is the best value I have found for a hotel near the Phoenix airport with a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: dcilliers
Reviews.Content: I booked this on Hotwire for $48 + tax (total $59.84) and was very pleased with the overall quality and value. The room was spacious and comfortable, a true suite with a completely separate bedroom with a door that closes (not like many that are called suites but actually just have a sofa sitting area. The bed was comfortable. WiFi was free and there was a desk area. One-up coffee was quick and easy. A bit of traffic noise from room 404. We arrived late and left early for a flight layover, so we did not use the pool or other facilities, but they looked nice and attractive. The only negative was the chicken quesadilla I ordered from the restaurant, delivered to the room - the worst I have ever had. Overall I would recommend and stay again at that rate!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it was ok. Not great for business professionals”
Reviews.Author: rusty4005
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels like an old hotel which they tried to make nice. It really isn't bad, but I think it is much more of a fanily hotel than a good place for business professionals away from home. It's nice to have free wifi, but I could only get 3 bars in my room. The front entrance is really nice and the rooms are not bad with two flatscreen tv's. I will say, though, there are very few channels on the tv which was a bit of a disappointment. Also, the shower water didn't get very hot and the room was not quite as clean as some may like. Also, the pillows are not comfy at all. Overall, I would say this hotel is pretty good, but really lacks nice finishes. I would not recommend for females traveling alone or anyone on business. Location is good, except the neighborhood to the east gets a little sketch. Front staff is real nice, but upon checking in and bring my items into the hotel on a roller rack they just watched my in my 4 inch heels struggle to push the cart with tons of heavy equipment. Oh, and it is a noisy hotel too. Don't expect to have a super peaceful stay here, but if you are with a group of family it would be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “LACK OF SAFETY AND GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Hermosillo75
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel personnel are nice and profesional,process was fast, when i got to the hotel room was very prety but there was bad smell like wet wood or carpet, then i was trying to log in to the internet but need password i had to talk to personnel to get it after that i was able to log in but internet super slow,at the end of the day i went out and inotice that the lock at the hotel room is loose thethe ac noise dont let u rest

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: dmz681
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night, flew in to see my brother and catch a Diamondback game. The facility is airport close, stadium close, and near the freeway. The facility is rather new so everything worked well. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. The following morning when I flew out I was running late and the shuttle driver was kind enough to wait for me and get me to the airport on time. The only adverse comment was that it was a windy night and staying on the upper floor, we heard the wind blowing and every so often it sounded as though it penetrated the vents for a piecing noise, but not a deal breaker. If you need a comfortable room near the airport with good staff, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here while on Business in Phoenix. The staff is 5-star! They are very accomodating and friendly. The rooms are spotless and the renovation that was completed is perfect. It is very upscale and current. Much more of a Hotel Indigo and much less of a Holiday Inn Express. The breakfast is great and the food from the restaurant is excellent. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXSusie
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights here and really enjoyed it. Very clean and the service and restaurant were above average. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: I expected a normal Holiday Inn Express but this was a beautiful property. The front desk staff was very nice, the room was exceptional, and there was even a free drink coupon since I was on an award night. The bartender was excellent too. Excellent location close to the airport. While I could see the planes taking off and landing, it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, horrible front staff”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraP55
Reviews.Content: New hotel. Rooms are spacious. Beds are very comfortable. Two flatscreens, one in bedroom and larger one in living room. Mini refrigerator in room. Front desk check-in person on afternoon of 8/26 was incredibly rude. We checked in and were directed to the elevator to go up to 4th floor. We had alot of luggage so piled it onto a luggage cart. Elevator had "Out of order" sign. Tried another and it was out of order too. Access to elevators was outside and the temp. was 117 (this is not a lie) so by the time we got back to front desk we were toasted. I went up to front desk to ask how we were going to get up to our room on the 4th and the guy told us he would call for someoneto help us but we would have to wait until he was done talking to the customer he was working with. It took 15 minutes. After customer left, I asked if he had made that call and he said he was just about to. I told him I thought it was rude to make us wait since we checked in first and the phone call would only take a couple of seconds. He said it was my fault; that once I left the front desk his priority became the next customr. We used priority points because my husband travels alot and maybe he didn't fully understand the concept.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property!”
Reviews.Author: CRBritt1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night with my family and we thought this property was great. We had a 1 bedroom suite and the room, living room, 2 TV's, bathroom, etc were excellent. The inside courtyard was very well maintained and we enjoyed the doors opening to the courtyard. We didn't eat at the restaurant for breakfast and we didn't visit the pool, but the pool looked great. Our only drawback was the air conditioning in the room. While it turned on, ran quietly, etc it never seemed to cool down the room. It ran for all of the hours were were there and it never got "cold' in either room even with the thermostat set at 60 degrees. Overall, with the spacious rooms, quick check in, friendly staff, we will frequent this hotel again when we are in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Ballgames”
Reviews.Author: Blaze24311
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed here for a trip to the ballpark (Diamondbacks). The shuttle picked us up from the airport and within minutes we were at the front desk checking in to our room. It was around 9pm and the bar/grill was open until 10pm. He whipped us both up a great meal ( which we repeated the next night after the game.) The room (suite) was much more then we expected 2 flat screens and a sitting room, two queen beds and a balcony.(too bad it overlooks the parking lot). The air conditioner was just a little noisy but kept the room comfortable. The drivers were all very pleasant (Joey is a kick!) and saved us a lot of parking and driving headaches. The pool was like bath water but still fun, happy to find out it was open until midnight. The last morning we had breakfast at the restaurant and shuttled back to the airport. Thanks to the whole staff who made this trip a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will surely go back with my family...”
Reviews.Author: ikazi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very elaborate suites, extremely comfortable. The pool is good, and the dining options though limited, pretty nice. Sleep quality - Great!! And best part, its a stones throw from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOOKING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: boat07
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room at the hotel and it had a very nice courtyard, gazebo and pool. the entrance to the hotel was also very nice. Our daughter told us that her room had dirty water and bugs. The front desk was very nice at check in and the shuttle driver was very pleasant as well. Housekeeping was good until the last day when we did not get our room cleaned. We had taken the sign off the door and had seen housekeeping staff walking around for the two hours while we hung out at the pool. We then left for the day and came back to a room that had not been cleaned. They did take the tip and thank you note however. We got a call from the head of housekeeping while waiting at the airport to say how sorry they were. She said she would look into what happened, We do not know what the outcome was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not crazy about exterior entrance”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGuy_7
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because needed to be close to airport. The hotel has been remodeled and although not brand new, it looks nice. Not located one mile from airport as stated on website though. Room was spacious and comfortable even though I don't care for hotels with exterior entrances. Nice lobby area and friendly staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn & Suites Phoenix Airport North
HotelInfo.Address: 1515 North 44th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
